intro: Downingia yina, commonly known as the Yina's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, basal leaves and clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Downingia yina is adapted to cold climates and is typically found in areas with high elevation and limited soil depth.
